Hi..Meet me Bharath & my wife Pallavi, yet another Software Engineer working for Big IT firms. When it comes to choosing Doctors, we always tend to go for a known Doctors. Same was with our case. We were doing Hit Refresh after 5 years. We have a son who is 5 years old. I am native of Davangere and as the schools were all online mode due to COVID, we kind off shifted to Davangere. It was December when my wife gave good news of our second pregnancy. We were doing all the regular check-ups with our known Dr. Divakar and everything was going well.

How did we meet Dr Geetha Nagarjun?

As the schools started and everything was offline, we shifted back to Bengaluru. It was June 24th; we were all set for our New Housewarming ceremony and my wife was 31 weeks pregnant. On that day my wife started bleeding. For a moment, my whole body became cold, and I was clueless on what had to be done. I quickly called up Dr. Divakar and explained the situation to him. He took some time and called me back and asked me to rush to MotherHood hospital near Devegowda Petrol Bunk and meet Dr. Geetha Nagarjun. He had met her during one of the conferences. Dr Divakar had informed Geetha with our situation. We asked our parents to carry on with the Housewarming pooja and we both started towards MotherHood hospital. It was close to 7kms from our House. Lots of negative thoughts going in our mind and not sure what will happen next. We reached the hospital around 7:30AM, Dr Geetha had already informed at the reception, and we were rushed to first floor for scanning. During the scan, the baby’s heartbeat and movements were normal and it gave a sigh of relief for us. Because of Dr. Geetha we didn’t go through the hassle of doing the registration at the Hospital until things got stabilized. My wife was admitted and was kept for observation for 4 days. In these 4 days, the only question that was going through my mind was “What If”. Dr Geetha explained to me about all the pros and cons and her aim was to put her under observation and see that we can push the delivery by couple of weeks as nothing can replace mother’s womb for baby’s development. Every day they used to scan and see the progress. On day 1, there was bleeding with adequate liquor. Day2, clots were gone, and liquor had reduced. Humans are prone to errors. Dr Geetha didn’t want to take a chance. She wanted to take a third opinion from a different radiologist and this time everything was normal, and we were discharged. She advised my wife to take complete bed rest.

Post Meeting Dr Geetha
MotherHood has a clinic in Kanakapura Main Road and Dr Geetha comes for consultation into that clinic. We had our regular checkups there and luckily my wife was able to complete 38 weeks of pregnancy. When the due date is nearing, the questions that come to everybody’s mind: will it be Normal or ‘C’ Section. Dr Geetha did her due diligence and suggested us for a C-Section. When it comes to our Indian tradition, given an option we always pick a date and time for good things to happen. Similarly, we fixed it for Aug 15th between 12 PM to 2:30 PM. Dr Geetha was very accommodative to do the delivery during this time. Every story should have a happy ending. On Aug 15th, we were blessed with a little angel.
 
Dr Geetha Nagarjun was great in both handling the complication that we faced and in delivering us our little princess. Dr Geetha is not just a very good as a doctor but is empathetic as well. She has very good experience despite being so young. All her suggestions & directions given throughout the last trimester journey helped us sail through the pregnancy & delivery at ease.
My wife was highly concerned about the delivery process and post-delivery pain & recovery. But, with Dr. Geetha’s support this phase was comfortable.
Thank you Dr. Geetha for Everything.

On discharge day when we offered some tips to the Nurse they refused.

I am happy both with the Doctor and the Hospital
